definition[0]: to move around within a system, or to make something do this
example[0]: Swimming helps to get the blood circulating through the muscles.
example[1]: Ceiling fans circulated warm air around the room.
definition[1]: if information, facts, ideas etc circulate, they become known by many people
example[2]: Rumours began circulating that the prime minister was seriously ill.
definition[2]: to send goods, information etc to people
example[3]: The group circulated petitions calling for a federal law to ban handguns.
definition[3]: to talk to a lot of different people in a group, especially at a party
definition[4]: to send a letter or information to people
example[4]: A summary of the report was circulated to all board members.
